title: Banned user still able to invited to reports as a collabrator and reset the password

profile.name: HackerOne
profile.about: Vulnerability disclosure should be safe, transparent, and rewarding.

vulnerability_information:
#Description:

* The permanently banned user account can't access any account features or reports and when accessing his profile he receives 404 not found so the account seems to be not signed or not found so the permanently banned user account must be can not access any HackerOne/account features anymore or access reports, but I was able to add the permanently banned user as a collaborator In the report and reset the password without any restrictions

##Steps to reproduce:

* I created an account and send a message to the support team to permanently ban the user account 

* After the account was banned I created a new test account and sandbox program 

* I send a collaborator request to the banned account so he must be can't receive the collaborator email

* But he invited to the report as shown below:

{F2309760}

* Also I can send and reset the password

{F2309761}

{F2309769}

* Here I reset the password

{F2309773}

* Now the banned user is able to join reports as a collaborator and reset his password and this restricted to banned user

## Impact

The banned user able to join reports as a collaborator and reset his password this Is restricted due to be permanently banned from the platform and must be can't access any data or use any feature from the HackerOne platform because his account Is seems to be deleted from the platform and must be can't access anything from his account or access any data

activities.message: Sorry about severity I mean 8.8 and I calculated on CVS's but It's added by mistake as a critical vulnerability

Hi @light3r,

Thank you for your submission. I hope you are well. Your report is currently being reviewed and the HackerOne triage team will get back to you once there is additional information to share.

Have a great day! 

Kind regards,
@h1_analyst_aaron

Hi @light3r,
I hope you are doing well.

Could you please share proper steps, from where/how you created a sandbox program. A video PoC would be really helpful.
And do we have to mail the support team to ban that particular user or it can be done from the sandbox program's admin account ?

I would love to take another look at your report once you have provided additional information supporting your issue.

Cheers,
@h1_analyst_aaron

Hello @h1_analyst_aaron 

Thanks for your response,

To create sandbox program 

* Create a test account 

* Navigate to https://hackerone.com/teams/new/sandbox

* Continue steps to create the sandbox program

** And do we have to mail the support team to ban that particular user or it can be done from the sandbox program's admin account **

* Yes must contact the HackerOne support team to permanently ban the HackerOne account

* I will create a video PoC below shows the PoC

* Here the video below shows the PoC

██████

Hello @h1_analyst_aaron 

Are changes available?
Hi @light3r! We need some time to validate your report. We will back as soon as possible. Thanks for your understanding!

Hello @martzen0x01, @h1_analyst_aaron 

There 15 days without any actions on report so can I know about any changes please?

Hey @light3r, we're still working on validating the report internally with the engineering teams. We'll let you know once we have an answer.

We're currently experiencing a high influx of incoming reports and that in combination with some holidays has resulted in a temporary higher resolution time than what you're expected from us, unfortunately.

Hello @zerotea @z0x01 @h1_analyst_aaron 

Thanks for your response, I know this might be a lot of reports and work makes HackerOne busy

But my report submitted 20 days ago without any actions from the internal team, so I hope changes/update available on my report

Thanks, 

light3r

Hello @zerotea @z0x01 @h1_analyst_aaron 

Also I hope tell me If you need any validation steps from my sides like videos/PoC's

Thanks,

Light3

Hello @zerotea @z0x01 @h1_analyst_aaron 

There are 25 days without any changes on my report so any changes/updates here on my report, please?

Thanks,

light3r

Hello @light3r,
I hope you are doing well.

The last update provided by the team was on May 8th (10 days ago). We will update the thread as soon as we have information to share.

Thanks,
@h1_analyst_aaron

Hello @zerotea @z0x01 @h1_analyst_aaron

Thanks for your response, but the report has been submitted a month ago without any actions on report no status change, or any other action and this does not meet HackerOne average SLA, so please let me know here about any other action report still on new status as shown without any actions from internal HackerOne team 

{F2366642}

Thanks, and please let me know about any actions on this report ASAP

Hello @zerotea @z0x01 @h1_analyst_aaron 

Please is there are any changes to the report?

Hello @z0x01 

Thanks for responding and changing the status, I ask why there is this delay on the report and the report was submitted a month ago. the average SLA Is less than the report submitted time
We have successfully reproduced the behavior you described and are currently working on a fix. Thanks for submitting!

Dear @zerotea @z0x01 @h1_analyst_aaron 

I just want to know Is this report eligible for rewards?

Thanks,

light3r

Thank you once again for letting us know about this. We really appreciate it! Right now, we are actively working on a solution. Once we implement the fix and it goes live, we will ask for it to be tested again. Keep up the great work, and happy hacking!

Thanks @z0x01 and HackerOne for the bounty

I’m sorry for my high volume of comments but my report was delayed until actions, anyway please accept my apologies if I made any spam of comments and thanks again for the bounty

Thanks, Have a great day,

light3r

Hey @light3r! Wanted to clarify the scope here just so I best understand. It sounds like there are 2 issues:
1. A banned user can be added as a collaborator to a report.
2. A banned user can reset their password.

I totally agree the first issue should be resolved. As for the second, is there any risk involved here that you can see? I think keeping the flexibility to allow users to reset their password is a good thing, as long as it doesn't allow them to access any additional features or circumvent any permissions.

We shipped a fix for the first item, so if you agree with my thoughts here I can move forward to a retest request for the collaboration fix. Thanks!

Hello @cmo 

Thanks for your response and sorry for any confusion, I only see the banned user cannot access his account or access any HackerOne features so I think this may be a misconfiguration for the banned user and he must didn't receive a reset password link when he permanently ban, maybe It's a mistake or misunderstanding on my side so I sorry for any confusion and sure you can request the retest now If available I'm ready to begin on It

again sorry for any confusion by me and thanks for explaining that

Have a great day,

light3r

Hello @zerotea 

Sure we can disclose, thanks for your respectful comment 

Have a great day,

@light3r
